title: 103_hr4022
content: TEMPORARY DUTY SUSPENSION for personal effects of 1995 Special Olympics World Games participants is added to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States. "9902.98.04 goods not intended for commercial sale: personal effects of participants, officials, or accredited members of delegations to events before 8/1/95." 1995 Special Olympics World Games participants and their immediate family members can import equipment and materials without commercial sale intentions. Participants and their immediate family members of the 1995 Special Olympics World Games can import equipment and materials without commercial sale intentions. Participants and their immediate family members of the 1995 Special Olympics World Games can import goods for use at the event or related exhibitions. Participants and their immediate family members of the 1995 Special Olympics World Games can import goods for use at the event or related exhibitions as prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Commissioner of Customs can waive entry bond requirements for goods under heading 9902.98.04 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule, making them tax-free. The enactment of this Act applies to goods entered or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption after 15 days. Requests for reliquidation of entries made between December 31, 1993, and 15 days after the enactment date can be filed within 60 days.
